intro: Chaetocarpus myrsinites, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and woody, aromatic leaves. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitats. However, due to overharvesting, it is now considered endangered in many regions.
